summary: snippets script for vim (like textmate or scribes have)
name: snipper
description:
see https://launchpad.net/snipper/ and http://tmske.blogspot.com/
you need vim with python enabled for this script
for the most recent package at all times you beter use the code of https://launchpad.net/snipper/
There are some templates in the package (python, c, xml, ...)

See http://snipper.googlecode.com/files/snipper-0.1-example.ogg for a small screencast of how snipper works
install_details:
unpack the package to a folder and see use.wiki in the package.

you need vim with python enabled, if you don't have python 2.5 you'll need cElementTree, that you can find
here: http://effbot.org/downloads/#cElementTree
on ubuntu: apt-get install python-celementtree

versions.release_notes:
complete refactor,
now it should work with python2.4 and it should also work when editing different buffers with different filetypes!
